tOGr_838yRFHWL9uGJ0oIg.text: Amazing food got the feast and Amber was our waitress she was amazing she helped us with recommendations and was so attentive checking on us refilling our drinks. We even got a to go dessert that she recommended even though we were stuffed. Y'all come have some of the best BBQ and food around! Amber will take care of you!

wl47BlKxyi31ibMGFdL63A.text: The food is food, the staff was friendly polite, and so far I haven't seen evidence of food poisoning which is why they got the second star.  Beyond that, I wouldn't recommend this place.  Order the "burnt ends" and what we got was a piece of brisket that they cut up into tiny squares. And none of it was burnt (got 2 pieces where I could taste one corner that was smoked).  I ordered the lunch double cheese burger and fries. What I got was 7 fries and a double Bubba burger. I think they just go to Costco to pick up a bag of frozen burgers. And why they couldn't give a decent portion of fries is bewildering.  My friend got the double meat bbq plate and said the beans tasted like cheap canned beans with relish in it. And the cornbread was so dry it fell apart.  Basically, if you like good service and bad food, this is the place for you. If crappy food doesn't interest you, go just about anywhere else.

HVNZLNAnFqZcwtiKQcgEnA.text: First time here, and we loved it tonight!  Very helpful staff and excellent food!  We will definitely be back to try out more!

wRZy34wyhR10NImFStp-Rw.text: Wow. Rough place. I do admit I have some pretty tough dietary restrictions (no salt, sugar), but almost every place I go to has no problem with that. Usually a grilled chicken breast or steamed broccoli or some other dish is available. Well not so much here. I spoke to the waitress who suggested the grilled chicken breast after telling me everything on their menu has s ton of salt in it. I wanted to order the grilled chicken breast with steamed broccoli but was told the broccoli was already seasoned in the bag (guess it was too hard for the cooks in the back to open a new bag of plain broccoli). I ordered a side salad and a grilled chicken breast. She came back out after a few minutes and let me know the chicken was also marinated and heavily salted. I ended up with a side salad (no egg, no bacon, no cheese, no crouton - yeah, lettuce, tomato, cucumber which where spoiled btw) and a side ramekin of vinegar - yumm...  Five bites later I was done with my "dinner". Got the bill and was in for my second disappointment. Was charged $4.99 for literally 1 cup of iceberg lettuce, four rings of rotten cucumber and 1oz of diced tomatoes. Shame on you!!!  Strike another's establishment off my list to eat...

XVYq0Xef1Pk8jZVKuuViYg.text: I moved from Boston 2 years ago and I was missing the BBQ but This place was amazing!! Huge portions! Great flavor!! Defiantly will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

26EQ07tmVciBshq7dWEkpw.text: Decent brisket - doubt I would order again Good service - nice folks Beer is expensive

U9n_BvkjQgwL2f07PxRc5w.text: Everything thing my wife and I ate here was great. We had ribs, brisket, pulled pork, and several sides. And the cornbread is worth the trip, just by itself. Service was fast and friendly. This is a place "we would bring people to."

IOl8Bj2HA1VwDefdn3xuUw.text: The service is great. Staff is very friendly. The barbcue sandwich is not the south east barbcue and will never compare.  It is not good.

qD5WByR3xwdfzzYrAahNOA.text: The food was excellent but the prices are a little steep! If you got the amount of bbq for the price they charge it would be ok but I didn't get what I paid for. I understand that it comes with sides but i'd rather have more meat than fillers.

DWW74GudFsKJ9zKhp17hNQ.text: I've eaten at Famous Dave's Restaurants all over the country.  Always very pleased with service, wait time and the very good beef brisket.  My wife and I went to their new location tonight and left very disappointed.  Our food  came out 20 minutes after our friends.  The waiter offered me some complimentary muffins while we waited which we refused.  We came to eat BBQ with our friends.  Finally, they delivered some beef scraps on a bun.  ( I wish I would have taken a pic). I complained to our waiter we were expecting sliced brisket which he said that is what they normally serve.  He had no idea why our's looked so bad.  He didn't offer to have the sandwiches remade and we were tired of waiting.    I strongly encourage the new franchise owner to get their act together.  I would have happily paid $10.95 for a very good sliced brisket sandwich,  not what we received.

-81DujCvX-ogBsX3vBoASw.text: Get the burnt ends! They are melt in your mouth delicious! The devil spit burger was very good, it was a nice mesh of flavors. I didn't think it was spicy (but as I've stated before I have a higher spice tolerance than most). I wasn't a huge fan of all the sauces but my SO said they were delicious. This place is definitely worth checking out and of course we are coming back again, although next time with a bigger group to get the large sampler.

-B-MyFlvrn2zwJD0XTnEKw.text: We were in town from Georgia doing work and after a 14 hour day, we were hungry and our motel was 100 yards away from Famous Dave's bbq and bar. The food was excellent and we ordered a beer apiece at the bar. I ordered 1 round of shots for me and my buddies. Since we already had a beer, the bartender said that we had to push our beers away before we could have the shots. I thought that was weird but being house rules, we abided. After about 15 minutes we were ready for our second beer and were told that their house rules would not allow us to have any other drinks until an hour had passed. If we had known that when we sat at their sissy ass bar, then we probably wouldn't be upset but they make the rules when the game is in play and we were not driving anyway we had walked from our room 200 feet away. They lost our business from now on when we're in the area. So beware before you think you're going to sit at the bar and have fun with your buddies. You definitely won't do at sissy Dave's!

M3h66lk6TPY6PCNZrERNSQ.text: Just fabulous!   The staff is super friendly, the food is delicious every single time.   We love going there!

j0H945vtIUzpfhM6jtTL5Q.text: Cool little spot next to carowinds. My husband had a chicken sandwich with onion strings and cheese on it. He liked it alot. The mac n chz was different.  Had jalapenos and corn in it. It was pretty good. I had bbq pork nachos. I advise everyone who goes there, not to get those. The cheese was cold shredded cheese, not melted at all. I asked my waitress if that's how its suppose to come, and she said yes.  They should definitely let people know when ordering them. I've never had nachos with cheese not melted on them. Such a weird way to ruin nachos. There are more things on the menu that look like they would be a better choice.  I really wish I remembered the name of our waitress. She was very friendly and the place had a nice upbeat environment.  We will return, but definitely not for bbq nachos

86tiL5yCA4VofrHr0trtUA.text: I absolutely love this place. The staff are top notch some of the best in town tbh!!! I always come in and order the ribs, tips or catfish finger and i have never been failed yet!! Cornbread muffins are delicious sweet and freshly baked (you can tell)!! If you're looking for an amazing BBQ joint, Great warm service and a good drink...Famous Dave's is where to Go...

H8Cx-nDd1PWTVidl-8zcxg.text: Best ribs and burnt ends I ever had. The staff is great and we will definitely be back.

sRDQtHEy-ejsY_ptqqe6TA.text: Go and check out my man Eric. This restaurant is soo good. I've had it in other states but this one is by far the best one. You've never experienced a bite of heaven until you try the brisket and pork. Definitely worth the drive from China Grove and will Definitely be back.

MuJdslvULQkRf0ZfEuiETA.text: Me and my BF and the kids went there just to try out their BBQ... hands down awesome! Usually we go to Smoke Pit in Concord and assuming it's the only BBQ that can compare to over TX... but yes I can say this is great! Another great BBQ gem! Must try! The service was hella great too!

1Xw6zB-0YfLUltdJH61BRQ.text: It is hard to say enough good things about this place. We had the burnt ends appetizer, and I had the combo plate of pulled pork and beef brisket. We split banana pudding for dessert which is scratch made in house!  Fabulous food!!!  As wonderful as the food was (and it was over the top), the best thing is the attitude of the staff.  This is a happy place. Service is stellar and done with genuine smiles. We were sitting in a spot where I could see into the kitchen, and they were smiling, helping each other, and seemed truly happy to be working together.  If Famous Dave's isn't legendary yet (they just opened a few weeks ago), they will be...and should be!  Go out of your way to eat here, it's worth it!!!

0xe-zGkL9KphbD73B513lA.text: I have eaten at Novi Michigan, Westland Michigan, Mall of America Minnesota,  Bellevue Nebraska, Sioux City Iowa, Sioux Falls South Dakota, Indianapolis Indiana and now my first visit to a Famous Dave's in Fort Mill South Carolina. It's about 45 minutes from my house. We enjoyed the service and the food. We'll be back since we have one closer to us now.

CdvK0pIzF3Px9Nyz2iZzuA.text: TWO WORDS. "MISS VAL!!!" She made my first visit the best experience I've had while dining. She's charismatic, fun and makes you have a good day. She went thru the entire menu and gave recommendations without being pushy. The food is fantastic! I recommend everything.

4qt5NNho11s6qV3b7WYOWA.text: I love coming here for lunch. Affordable, great food, and good quantity! I recommend the bbq chicken or the "burnt ends" Service and staff was friendly too. Will come back.

wCq69jqTl0-7pYKxOc1oRg.text: I have visited Famous Dave's in Virginia a few years back and it was fabulous! Now, we have one in Fort Mill, SC and I have been there several times.  I have gone with friends, with my family, have had delicious to go platters to enjoy at home and ALWAYS! Everything has been delicious!  It is also fun that they have from time to time different dishes to try including grilled salmon, soups, a variety of vegetable dishes and not to mention a delicious Mac and Cheese!  I recommend this place to anyone who like to receive great service, fun atmosphere and just plainly have a good time! For sure we will be back with more family and friends!

QIjgZyy5U6kfmPHDTTtylA.text: Great service and honestly, the food came so fast we hadn't even finished tasting all the sauces. Great stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

2j9oyBhQSr91VMrx4vnkrw.text: At first there is a sticker shock, BUT so worth it for the amount of delicious food you receive.  Personally, there is enough for 2 meals.  Highly recommend.  St. Louis style ribs and Georgia pulled pork.  Excellent!

t1-m4YDA9gTfwkFiYXt-VQ.text: Before even walking in the front door you're hit with the wonderful smell of cooked meats, walking inside it only got better. The interior of this location was certainly different than other Famous Dave's I've visited, more of a modern trendy vibe than the country saloon style I expected. We were seated right away and had our drink order taken by our server Val. Super polite and friendly, answered all our menu questions and kept our drinks (like the wonderful sweet tea) full the entire visit. My order consisted of the seasoned chicken tenders, Georgia chopped pork and firecracker green beans with a cornbread muffin. The chicken was nice and juicy, but the dry seasoning/rub is what really sets them apart from your average chicken finger. I haven't been to a Famous Dave's in years, but they were just as good as I remember. Pork, also juicy, cooked well, but not my favorite sauce I've ever had. Green beans were yummy, but didn't really get why they were supposed to be "firecracker green" beans, not that spicy. Lastly the cornbread. OH THE CORNBREAD. Easily the best cornbread I have ever had, anywhere. Buttery, moist, just a little sweet. Amazing. It's worth a visit for the cornbread alone but I don't think you'll be disappointed by anything you order.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Seasoned Chicken Tenders, Georgia Chopped Pork, Firecracker Green Beans and an outstanding Cornbread Muffin!
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

o4nGQZhq9R00Px2HSST_gQ.text: I paid $19.47 for 3 brownies I never received. When I called I was told "call grubhub, we cant do anything for you." I was also talked over and yelled at repeatedly by manager Eric

NWninPfkX7u5JodgV9et-A.text: The take out service is terrible, they rarely get the order right and they could take some lessons in customer service.  I've visited Famous Dave's in other cities, with no problem. My guess is this one won't be in business long.

k_bgmb6iIsyavo8qo6xzXQ.text: As always.. excellent bbq and we had the best service when we went in.. we had a family of 6 and she was very attentive and took care of the kids first which we always appreciate..  We will be back and be back often

VHC_XdgMOzKyiYRfF81AyQ.text: Smells good and tastes good. Please note on weekends, dinner prices all day ( not listed on menu) Also did not notice flavored teas having a 99 cent refill despite already priced at $3.79. A little steep considering Longhorn are similarly priced and prepared with free refills. Hostess service was good and table service very good. Vail is really personable and knowledgeable of the menu. Most of the crew looked happy to be working, so that is positive.   Restrooms were well-appointed. Will return the work week and take advantage of lunch specials. Could see this place being really busy with warmer weather and Carowinds crowds.

1v38wtR8fANQCzsnWqRMYQ.text: Delicious food and great service. We had the feast for 2 which was plenty of tender meat,beans and a creamy Cole slaw as a good pairing. Recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. The location outside Carowinds
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Delicious food and great service. Feast for 2

fs9oJL7Anm3OtqefIHGWrA.text: Food was ok, but we had a party of 12 and apparently they could not handle it! Took an hour after slow service to figure out the check, and after a 2/12 hour dinner no offer to discount the bill! Won't be back!

r7Lzl-BamE_KYswUrlR6LQ.text: On a work trip out of town and had some Famous Dave's delivered to my hotel from this location using Postmates app. Food arrived hot and fresh with everything I ordered including utensils. Quality of the brisket and sides and baked potato I got was wonderful. I felt very satisfied after eating this meal.

JJm4L-xpU4rbg0fvyKHoCg.text: This is the first restaurant I've given 5 stars to. I'm from up north and we had a few of these guys around where I lived and was bummed when I moved to the Carolinas and there were none. The Carolinas have a few good BBQ places, but they aren't FD. I was ECSTATIC to learn there was finally a FD by Carowinds.   I feel like they've made some updates since the last time I visited. First they have some vegetarian-friendly items (which is something they lacked before which is why I was only able to go once in the past five years - my wife is vegetarian). Second, the staff is super friendly. The manager (don't know his name. He's a bearded dude) is the right guy who clearly sets the tone for this location. They've built a great team. Everyone pitches in to help so it's super efficient.   Ok onto the food - that's why you're here. I used to only get the wings (best wings in my opinion - very little fat. Great sauce, though they've since added more so it complicates things a bit, but they do have great BBQ sauces now and you can order the wings naked) and the hot link sausage. I've only recently tried the brisket and OH MY GOSH. It was so flipping good. The first time I went it was moist and fell apart. Every piece had so much flavor I almost cried. The second time I went it was a bit dry but still good.   The cons - it's pretty pricey so I only go at lunch. Their lunch specials are a really great value. The other con is that every side is very blah - the mashed potatoes didn't have any flavor, the jalapeno Mac n cheese is ruined by the presence of jalapenos - just make some great unhealthy Mac n cheese (like baked m&c with breading) and we'll be good. My wife said the corn on the cob is too soft/spongy.  So despite the lackluster sides and high-ish prices (dinner), it still gets 5 stars as the only place I'll go to for BBQ from now on. Oh yeah, their bread pudding...it's slap yo mama good.

3d8Qo_n2DN8aivQ_nHWNVA.text: Carry out was easy and simple! I ordered carry out at this location since we are staying next to Carowinds. I ordered the sampler platter. I called and arrived in 7 minutes. My order was hot and ready. I entered the dine-in area. I was directed to the separate carry out area. The food was delicious. It's a great location to enjoy good close to home cooking food next to Carowinds!!

MjCbIBD-GmBjxpyu0TO3iQ.text: I've had a lot of BBQ and this is a really solid spot. The waitress was super informative and even gave us a tour of all the sauces with chips to dip. They keep one sauce in the back if you are curious to try but beware-- it is HOT! My mouth was burning for several minutes after trying it. On to the food, I had the pulled pork and my sister and brother in law had brisket. All of it was delicious! My only gripe with the place were their sides. I had collard greens and they were very unspectacular and my fries tasted old. The meat alone was good enough to give them a 4 I only wish the sides were better. I did try the mac and cheese which was very good so maybe I just picked wrong. Overall, this place is fairly priced and you get more than enough bang for your buck. I recommend after a long day of riding coasters at Carowinds and make sure to wash all that BBQ down with a cold beer  Salud!

ZYS3itoxubygIBreJLFWbQ.text: I am so glad that we stopped by! We were looking for a quick bite. I am from Ohio and they have Famous Dave's there. This place did not disappoint!!! The service was top notch. The server was so knowledgable and made the best recommendations. I can not wait to go back. Its refreshing to go to a place where it's obvious that they care about their customers!!!  The food was fast, and delicious! Thank you again Famous Dave's!

QHEokk2tZ63JI0M502GxrQ.text: The food was great, but I ordered a starter for my main course thinking it was a bigger portion than the meal- a starter is supposed to be like an appetizer, is it not? I received 3 tenders? The starter alone- which consisted of 3 chicken tenders costs $10.

YUXlQOKi01ajQTB4lvhVFg.text: Now before I write this I must tell you I come from a small town where barbecue is on every corner an we have no chain places that sell BBQ.  So I am a barbecue snob, so here it goes.  The place smelled great an they have a pig in a costume of which I loved the pig. For me choices were limited if you like spicy everything pretty much had some kind of heat to it I was bummed.  Their mac n cheese had jalapenos in it that doesn't belong .  I wanted the cat fish fingers but the cornmeal it was rolled in was hot :(   I finally got the pulled pork sandwich I added slaw because if your from the south cole slaw comes on a BBQ sandwich SMH. However the slaw was not home made, Fries were my side well they were not crispy just barely warm.  If your wanting some BBQ this isnt BBQ to me but stop in an try it.  I know its a chain I assume they are not from the south, but I tried it:)

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Side salad
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with fries an a side of cole slaw

NdhiaiueBLn74ZnK-3sSkw.text: Ordered via Uber eats and they did not disappoint! I had the brisket bowl which comes with mash potatoes, onion rings, and collards. I also added macaroni and bread pudding for dessert. Will purchase again.

I3kSbmIPJFwQ-Sfq31umoA.text: We went here as an office for a work lunch and I doubt I will go back on my own dime.   The facility is completely new and squeaky clean and the food came out quickly. I opted for the two meat lunch combo - brisket and wings with a side of mac and cheese. The brisket was a little dry but the boneless wings weren't bad. Nothing special, but not bad. The mac and cheese was disappointing even before I bit into a large piece of plastic wrap. That definitely put me off the rest of the meal.  There are too many fabulous BBQ options within a couple miles to eat a meal that's mediocre.

qFchxa7JOLvCUFOVsPGPVw.text: We made another visit back to Famous Dave's tonight and we had an interesting experience. I ordered the BBQ salad and it came absolutely drenched in bbq sauce. It didn't taste like salad dressing at all. Just really sweet bbq sauce all over my salad. I asked our server for some ranch dressing. He stared at me, stared at my salad and gave me a really quizzical look like shaming me for asking for more dressing. He then said "well I can get you some but it's an additional .29 charge". My husband assured him we could handle the surcharge and off he went. Took him forever to come back with it, but he did oblige. I mean really??  I'm paying $12 for a salad with barely any meat to begin with and he's going to charge me for salad dressing that should have been on the salad to begin with?  Is this Zaxby's charging me for an extra Zax sauce ;). I mean it just seemed ridiculous to even suggest I pay that but whatever. We certainly had a good laugh as we left.   Overall, service was slower this visit and the meat portions seemed less generous, but the visit was fine (excepting the saucy salad and saucy waiter!).

JgY7NJd1x1-a2uwlcVA-6Q.text: I grew up in Minnesota so when Dave's opened I was excited!  Of course there is plenty of BBQ in the area, but nothing like the stuff at Dave's.  The sauce and food is just like I remembered back home.  The decor is homey and open.  I did hear uncensored music playing.  My only complaint is that the soup was a bit on the salty side.  It was almost inedible, but I was able to wash it down with a lot of water.  I don't like the new fries.  They are not seasoned enough.  The chicken tenders are flavored well with Dave's seasoning.  The catfish fingers are moist on the inside and have a delicate flavor.  The tartar like sauce offers a nice spice to the fish.  The cornbread muffins are amazing.  In fact, they are cat-worthy.  My cat is a jerk because she decided to eat it when I left it on the kitchen counter overnight.  I heard a microwave in use during my visit, can you guys at least hide it from public view?

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. 2 meat combo with chicken tenders and catfish  fingers, fries, chicken wild rice soup

VcAl5DDGYY3aWV9RqgCUZQ.text: This place was a pick by my 13 year old son who seen it back in the cuts when he was on a camp trip to Carowinds this past Summer. And let me say I'm glad we listened and that he likes to try new restaurants even though he's still a picky eater. There was so much to choose from so I settled on the Sampler which gave you catfish fingers, chicken tenders, string onion rings, bbq tips and four different sauces to dip. I feel like I'm leaving out something but anywho it ALL was delicious. Especially the tips and catfish fingers(never heard of that before) but I love catfish so it was a Win Win. My server Sky was very nice, informative and helpful...all with a smile. Different staff members as well as the manager came over to our table multiple times to make sure we were good and enjoyed the food. The ambience is cool, they also have a full bar and televisions. I also had Dave's Rum Punch which was recommended by Sky(she never tried it) and it was amazing and came with a grilled pineapple on a stick. My family and I will be back for one of our weekly takeouts. And definitely will be telling others about this spot tucked away in SC

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Famous Dave&#39;s Rum Punch
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. The Sampler...was actually enough for two. Had leftovers for lunch the next day
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

YStFnmAf4bK3q94a7Ucozg.text: Always amazing! I love the pineapple bbq sauce and boneless wings. But the best is the banana pudding.  My dad introduced me this place in Maryland and when this location opened it fast became my GO TO dinner pick.

PtklgxZ3KHkEUdcIQq6opQ.text: Very disappointed with the restaurant and with trying to order with grub hub. We ordered online at 545 with a delivery time of 625-635. At 7, I contacted grub hub because the tracking said our food wasn't even on the way. The driver called me shortly after and said she had just gotten there and our order wasn't even ready yet.  We ended up just cancelling our order, so can't comment on the food, but not likely going to try it again after this experience

64m3GIcFkUasI_H80tJc0w.text: Ordered this for take out while passing through Be sure to check your orders.  They didn't include the fries we ordered and were extremely skimpy on the extra side of barbecue.

WGvXK_jy9nAr4cjUgyXO8w.text: We were visiting with some friends. It happened to be trivia night run by Wilson one of the local celebrities/news stations WCCB. What a fun time. We started our meal off with an order of the burnt ends. These were a plate of deliciousness. They were tender pieces of the beef brisket seared in one of their famous sweet & Zesty sauce and came with a few fried onions. Some in our group order the feast for 2. What a dish. 1/2 slab of their ribs, half chicken, brisket or pork. They ordered the pork. It was so much food. All was good. If you have a favorite flavor of sauce for BBQ then this is your place. There were lots of sauce options from the Rich & Sassy to the Devil's spit hot sauce. The one down side was what they called the Eastern style BBQ sauce. I was looking forward to having this option and was expecting a good vinegar based BBQ sauce. What I was delivered was more of a sweet vinegar sauce that had way too much tomato sauce mixed in with the vinegar. To me this is not the Eastern style. I was a little disappointed. For the balance of the meals ordered, a brisket, wings and salmon dish was ordered. All tasted great and would order them again. The side dishes we ordered were so delicious. The collard greens and garlic mashed potatoes were some of the best ever. There was a wide selection of side options that included steamed broccoli, sweet corn, Wilbur beans (loaded baked beans with smoked pork, brisket hot link sausage jalapenos with the Rich and Sassy sauce), creamy coleslaw, mac and cheese grilled pineapple,  sweet mashed potatoes, potato salad and loaded baked potatoes.  Our service was great. The food was delivered in a timely manner and was a good warm/hot temperature. We would go back.

97_uveWaFRAhvXfx3WbQZg.text: I've eaten a lot of bbq and this is the best. Lot of variety in styles. Pulled pork and ribs are to die for.  Grilled pineapple and baked beans recommended.  I can't wait to come back. I wish I could fit more in my belly now lol

D-b4XQv0f2onQttHiOX0Tg.text: The ribs, Mac & cheese, cole slaw and corn bread were delish.  The chicken needed more flavor and the brisket was too salty to enjoy.  The staff was friendly and fast.  I would come back for more ribs.

I5Px7VS5AhIJueiTfq8QdQ.text: Definitely a great spot to hit up!  The food was good and the service was great. Famous Ashley was a phenomenal server, attended to all our needs, and helped us with any questions we had. My wife ordered the Double spit burger which was cooked exactly to her liking (hockey pucked).   My daughter and I ordered the Feast for 2 which came with all the fixin's you could ask for. It came with HUGE helpings of Ribs, your choice of pulled pork or brisket, 1/2 a chicken, coleslaw, bbq beans, and fries. And 2 corn bread muffins. We even had enough to bring home with us (it's a shame I didn't get a picture of it but be ready because it's a lot of food) The brisket was out of this world. So tender you could cut it with a fork and juicy too, not dry. My daughter had the ribs which I didn't hear any complaints coming her side of the table. Everything was so nice we'll definitely be coming back.

RCaX5SU2IL-wHXN-jXNxoQ.text: My husband lived in Florida and was so excited to spot the new Famous Dave's on our trip to Carowinds on Friday, so of course we stopped for dinner after the park. We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by the bartender, who introduced us to the concept and provided a sauce tasting. She even let us try some sides after questioning them. The Mac and cheese was on point! We ordered and has a delicious meal, with the manager coming around several times to speak with us. We'll definitely return and are hopeful one will open in Winston Salem!

-ejybmQDppZCksgYOAppLA.text: Great experience. Waitstaff was great and the food was even better. Dont pass up the brisket, the jalapeno sausage, and the mac and cheese.  And for dessert yummy Breadpudding.

7kOI7vTEV5zWcof2_iz3Rw.text: This was my first visit at Famous Dave's and I was very impressed. Service is top notch and the bbq was excellent and priced right. Chili had chunks of meat and beans too. Chili meat was very tender and had the right amount of spicy heat. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and it was excellent. They offer potato chips with a sampling of various bbq sauces. The Devil's Spit is fantastic. Will definitely return.....Soon!

-EYJBuzG7DGYbxsyfv3_lg.text: Food was great. Very flavorful and great sauces to compliment. Extremely hard to get through when trying to place an Togo order. We ordered the sampler platter and bbq nachos with NO BEANS to share between my boyfriend and I.  There was MORE than enough food. On the sampler platter we wanted bone in wings but got boneless. Had to call the store numerous times to get through but they called me back and we went back to the restaurant to trade for the bone in. We finally got home and once we started eating we noticed that our nachos were LOADED with beans .

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

oVmiITjlNI4KQZoFytq4xQ.text: Highly disappointed. We are from the Midwest and Dave's is one of our favs back home.   Let's start with Famous Brian, our waiter. What's he famous for, being a horrible waiter? He literally doesn't listen and walks away from you as you are speaking to him. He did this the entire visit.  The food has something lost in translation between its roots and here in the south. It's just ok, not great as we're accustomed.  Really bummed because the bbq here isn't very good and we were happy to see a Dave's open.

hzw3SMEUe7oveqw0nwgyMA.text: I bought a Local Flavor (Groupon-type site) certificate for here a few months ago. It was $15 for $30 worth of food, plus they were having a 25% off sale. A twenty dollar savings was reason enough for us to check it out.   We arrived shortly after a nasty thunderstorm on a summer Saturday afternoon. As such, the place was crowded with families who were escaping Carowinds. There were only two of us so we sat at the bar. The bartender was awesome - very nice and friendly but I don't remember her name. They have the typical beers for the masses, plus some local ones such as OMB, Catawba, and Sugar creek. They also have drinks such as smoked bourbon which looked interesting.  We ordered the fried cheese curds as our appetizer which were good. For her entree, she got cedar plank salmon with steamed broccoli and corn on the cob. She said the salmon was delicious. I love Texas-style brisket, so I ordered that along with grilled pineapple and famous fries. The brisket was about six large, tender sliced pieces (not chopped). I did not have to use a knife to eat it. Although it was tender, it was somewhat lacking in flavor. However, it was still good. The grilled pineapple steaks had an unexpected kick to them but were also good. The famous fries were not something I would order again. They had no flavor and were a little on the dry side.   So, 3.5 stars for the food and an extra half star for the service equals four stars. I would go again.

YCe2ZcfxMOf7oz9UlrMSWw.text: Went for lunch. Parking lot was empty. I ordered to go and was assisted by Rachel as she trained. They were sweet however this is about the food.  I wss a bit disappointed. As a midwesterner who knows BBQ and grew up eating Famous Dave's  I expected that smoke to smack me in the face. It didn't. I ordered the brisket sandwich which was mostly marbling/fat with very little meat. I kept it simple with fries. I wanted to ease in. I wasn't wooed. Normally, the brisket is piled on the bun. The meat was undercooked but I understand that southerners eat theirs medium well down here. So, I'm not going to complain about that. The fat with the red meat tasted different but after I tired their sweet and spicy sauce I decided it was well worth the trouble. My sandwich was cold. No, more lukewarm as was the fries. I bought a ranch for an extra .35 because its made in house but its more dill dip than ranch.   I might have to give it one more try and eat inhouse before I say no more. The 3 stars is mostly due to Rachel as the food was not impressive.

iOSKUsWlkElApQUwsfDYNA.text: While my family and I were in town to visit Carowinds we decided to try them out for lunch.  I am a stickler for checking Yelp before we eat places so I definitely went with high expectations since I saw a 4 star rating. My husband and I had the Catfish fingers with steamed broccoli,  garlic red mashed potatoes and the corn bread muffin. Our daughter had chicken fingers and fries.   Let's just say it was really really good.  I was looking for more pescatarian or vegetarian options  since I don't eat meat,but it was only the typical options given at a restaurant which was not all together bad  considering that a lot of barbeque places where we are from only offer French fries.   Overall, I definitely see us coming back to eat here next year when we visit Carowinds again.   Also the staff was very helpful and nice!!  Side Note: Please keep Mrs. Beverly's muffins on the plates.  They are AMAZING!!

r_Ct_1MXAQ_sqFRqIyYRoQ.text: Picked up dinner tonight as it was on the way and my wife specifically asked for ribs. I probably could have ordered ahead but as it worked out, the ribs were ready very quickly and I did not wait more than 5 minutes. That's service!  Ribs were pronounced "excellent" and the cole slaw was great. Enough sauce (though sweet), quite meaty and delicious. Packed properly and still hot when they got home.  We'll be getting Dave's again, no doubt.  [Review 10938 overall, 710 of 2019.]

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Famous Dave&#39;s ribs with their cole slaw, plate up at home
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Famous Dave’s next to Carowinds in Fort Mill, SC

rmB5m7Mna9aCEO108Gv_SQ.text: I've heard so many great reviews about this place it saddens me to give a bad review but my overall experience was not good. First off they are completely short staffed and the staff they do have seems confused with one exception to a very lovely server who basically took all of our orders although she was not our server. The food took forever to come out and when it did everything came out at once even though we had ordered an app. The wings we ordered were sweet n sassy very delish. The bbq pork sandwich although very tasty was a bit too smoky. The stuffed baked potato didn't have much stuffing but was an okay baked potato. My real qualms about this place are the prices are pretty ridiculous for southern food and the service was terrible. I will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu

mR3NLKwqCgkaMI9wfRMGUA.text: I ordered the Founder's Feast for $21.99 (ribs, chicken, chopped pork, baked beans, cole slaw and muffin). The food was plentiful and delicious. It was enough to feed three people. The food was served on a platter with dinner plates. Our waiter checked on us periodically and had a pleasant attitude. This was my first time visiting. I plan on returning when I'm back in the area.

qD0nkxgDIOQ6Ld1y-CDnGg.text: Ahhh, if they could just build one closer to Charlotte!!  Yum!  We first encountered a Famous Dave's BBQ in Northern VA, and we're hooked from the first taste.  The place has plenty of tables and room to put them together for big groups.  You can also see into the cooking area which is kind of neat.  Brightly lit, very courteous staff, very clean place.  We have tried just about all of the meats (bbq, brisket, etc.) and they are consistently tender & juicy from restaurant to restaurant.  They come "naked" but seasoned, and you can choose from 6 (I believe) sauces - from the sweeter to more savory to the Holy #$%& hot one!  I love the house one, not real sweet but has loads of flavor, hubby likes the Carolina one.  My kids have always loved their chicken tenders.  White meat, very light coating with their amazing spicy rub on them.  My son usually asks for a little side container of the rub so he can add more!  Husband &  I both love the brisket and pork bbq.  It is always tender with no gristle.  And can't forget their fries:  hot, crisp outside and sprinkled with their rub seasoning.  Prices are about average for a bbq joint, but if you have a choice - GO HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

mNXZzOxXPBumN2iBGQfGRQ.text: Ordered via delivery service through work and I'd like to say I'm impressed. Being a Texas girl and always seeing folks say they got the "best BBQ" or "Texas style" something, this is pretty good. The steamed broccoli is deeelish! I thought I wanted more sauce on the Texas Beef Brisket sandwich, but nope it lets me take in all the flavors of the brisket. Great job! Now I need to go visit them and try some other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States

tXlEt1eb9tL7r_23RdBQ1Q.text: My husband and I just happened into this place earlier in the week.  (Truthfully, we had a coin toss between trying this, or going to Moe's next door.)  Let me say, I was wowed.  As we walked up to the entrance, the door was opened by a lady with the biggest smile who already had menus in hand ready to take us to our table.  I don't think that she was a host, possibly a manager (she had on a burgundy polo and ran expo for most of our visit.)  Moments after we sat down, we were greeted by "Famous Val"- who was perky, sweet, and very helpful.  Val was one of the most attentive (but not overbearing) servers that I have ever had.  This girl never stopped going.  While most of the servers in the restaurant seemed to trod around and barely smile, Val whizzed around greeting tables, running food, and cleaning.  Amazingly, on top of all that, she seemed to know everything that we needed before we even had to ask her.    I think that the small portion of fries to taste test the variety of sauces before your entree arrives is fantastic!  I am always one to have lots of little dollops of sauce on my plate from tasting them all throughout my meal, but Dave's lets you taste test before your food even arrives.  On the topic of food, we ordered the boneless wings and one of the "feasts" to get a taste of a variety of offerings.  Everything was amazing (including the grilled pineappple!)   Overall, we will definitely be back!

aQm7k-4YzmO8Idbygmoweg.text: Stopped for lunch before we headed into the park. It was our first time at a Famous Dave's. The food was fabulous. I had the double cheeseburger and my husband had the BBQ chicken baked potato. The service was absolutely great. Jamie was our server. Such a sweet lady. We left full. Definitely worth it

bQUZhlvb0KvV1EpkGVKvyw.text: Definitely worth a visit! Decided to try it out while visiting Charlotte and I'm glad I did. Famous Heather at the bar was amazing and took great care of me. And when she tells you that the catfish fingers are delicious, believe her!

-eCKur0HOEbsDd8dv3JoaA.text: The only reason I give two stars is, the staff is very nice. The food was not good, I was not impressed at all. It wasn't clean. The high chair we got for my daughter was sticky and gross. The table was sticky. The bathroom was even a mess, not to mention the watered down soap (in order to stretch the soap cost I assume...)  The nachos were not good at all. Soggy bean soaked chips. And the chicken wings, hardly had any meat on them. The kids burger was way better than anything we got. So at least my son like it.  Just so disappointed. If you want good fresh BBQ go to Macs speed shop (like we should have)

wff-ADTIwT2HxfjaiNbgEg.text: Best brisket ever. We're fans of this sauce called devil's spit and we were absolutely delighted to learn that this is the place it originated from! Johnny was a great server, attentive and polite, accommodating and professional. Thanks for a great experience from famous Amy and famous Dusty! We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Three meat combo with catfish fingers, bbq chicken and brisket.
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu logo

92z3aILVosEmadEFEqk6CA.text: Very good food experience after a long day at Carowinds amusement park. Great bbq and beer

mKaVsqoxLBMoFtO_Hkwsvg.text: We live pretty close and came here for a friend's birthday. We had a large group and were seated right away.   The service was really friendly, but when I asked what custom soda flavors they had they said they didn't know the full list because they can make a lot of different flavors. They did eventually get back to me, but it was a little weird that it wasn't on the menu and the server didn't know.  I got the two meat combo with rib tips and brisket. For sides I got Mac and cheese and grilled pineapple. It also came with a cornbread muffin. I wasn't a big fan of the meats. The ribs were a little better than the brisket but neither were great. I didn't really like all of the sides. The grilled pineapple was my favorite. I shared a banana pudding for dessert which I wasn't impressed by. It was mostly whipped cream and vanilla wafers with very little pudding or bananas.   All in all, I thought it was just ok. I would probably go elsewhere to get BBQ in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Two meat combo with brisket, rib tips, Mac and cheese, and grilled pineapple

rJ3xf4Eqdna9GMoL9hWIuw.text: Star deducted for the missing shack fries 1st visit.  Salty and overly salted onion straws on the 2nd visit.  Dear Lord, that baby fry cook must've thought he was making this for himself.  I was going to give 4 stars when I started this review a few weeks ago.  As of tonight, it'll be 3 stars and I'm submitting an application for employment. I cannot let Famous Dave's go under here. Ewww. I can't. Why? I'll have the trifecta if I can get a Pizza Extreme here for Chicago Deep Dish... then I"ll have all my Midwest places + Some kind of Southern living (e.g. Culver's, Famoud Dave's, Chicago Pizza, Sonic's for a slush, blah blah blah).   Well, wish me luck. I thought about just picking up tables but now I think I need to submit for management. They legit never answer that phone and I blew it off the first runs since I called at opening but middle of the day during the evening and I'm still getting voicemails... Le Sigh~  P.S. Catch Lunch and try everything. I recommend most everything except these new fries, that mac & cheese I refuse to even try since it has corn and always always pick up an ALL AMERICAN FEAST to accommodate all.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Top left corner: LUNCH MENU. Served Monday - Friday, 11a - 4p
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. 2 meat lunch combo: hot link &amp; harden rib tips. Look, I want and neeeedd this place to succeed.
Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Trying to show yall the environmentally friendly containers for togo orders. Plus, color sheet &amp; mustard sauce for the hot link.

IolJLKOwLpWbyg9zoxzTCg.text: Ordered through Door Dash, small order but it was my dinner. Food arrives and there are no napkins, no utensils and the food is cold. Chili without utensils is impossible. Cold food sucks! Called the store and was placed on hold for over 4 minutes, I finally hung up and went downstairs. The hotel was nice enough to heat my food and give me utensils. Stay away, there is better food nearby!

yodRduF4AnMUdT9SZqf8Mw.text: Outstanding food. Only complaint was server was rushing you the entire time. Price was average I found. If you like BBQ this is a must try. Def will be back if in area

oFPqWL3fnksOANihJHibAg.text: Everything we got was wonderful. The service was fast and exceptional!  We have been to other famous Dave's and this one is the best one we have experienced.

photos.caption: Photo of Famous Dave's Bar-B-Que - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Wonderful!  Everything we got was amazing

Q2GEZwOyVR9liqJglJyK6A.text: The BBQ was dry and WAY too salty. I like tender and moist BBQ similar to Midwood or City. Dave's Mac and cheese had jalapenos (not suitable for children). Their collards had bacon and sausage (they are trying too hard to create something new instead of embracing simple goodness). I was surprised at the lack of quality in this place. I doubt I will be back.
